result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob W Lasiewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Lasiewicz to 2 years of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year. This sentence is to to be served consecutive to sentences in being.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
 per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no presence at 365 West Polk in Waterloo

Arresting Agency: Waterloo PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 3:18pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Jacob W Lasiewicz in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "  No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Lasiewicz guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Lasiewicz

The Court sentences Mr. Lasiewicz to  2  years of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  year.  This sentence is to to be served consecutive to sentences in being. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
Atty. Zarwell requests additional time to investigate days credit
--The Court grants this request; Atty. Zarwell is to submit an analysis to the court

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no presence at 365 West Polk in Waterloo
--to pay costs of $268

The Court does not order a DNA surcharge due to date of violation
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 3:51pm

Case called at 9:19am [mo]
Defendant Jacob W Lasiewicz in court, in custody with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Officer Sarah Thomford -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--cross examination by Attorney Zarwell
--Atty. Zarwell submits Defendant's exh. #1(Police Report)
--re-direct examination by ADA Teuber

Argument given by Atty. Zarwell

The Court finds that the non-consent element is established
The Court recites Abraham v. State, Hansen v. State, Gautroaux v. State
The Court makes findings and conclusions
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Lasiewicz committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Atty. Zarwell submits a Request for Substitution of Judge. 
--The Court finds this filing has been made timely and proper

The Court grants the substitution.
The Court directs the Clerk to take appropriate steps under 808.58.
recess: 9:43am

Defendant Jacob W Lasiewicz appears via video conferencing from the Dane County jail, in custody.

[MK] case called at 2:20pm. 
Defendant Jacob W Lasiewicz appears via videoconferencing from the Dane County Jail, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney David Zarwell appears in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
.
Mr. Lasiewicz provides a new residential address, which he will reside at after release from incarceration:   N3502 Hwy. TT, Columbus WI 53925.

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:

--to remain absolutely sober
